Dear command line lover.
Your request is special. It might match the NetBea=
ns vision of the IDE 
reproducing to 100% everything that happens on comman=
d line. Give it a try. 
NetBeans have excellent support for Maven, can deal=
 quite well with (even 3rd 
party created) Ant scripts and there is an expe=
rimental support for Gradle.

However, this still requires your checkout is=
 buildable from command line. 
Checking-out a single file and hoping the ID=
E will think-up the surrounding 
environment is beyond the scope of what Ne=
tBeans (and obviously any other IDE) 
can do. 

We are trying to aim at "se=
lf describing sources": When you have (you have 
checked out) sources that =
a (supported) command line tool can understood, 
NetBeans understands it as=
 well.

-jt

ks,

d

> choi=
ce.  I also already program in about two dozen languages.

ea legs I want to compare and contract Eclipse,

> I need to grock some java code in an e=
xisting SVN repository.  I want

e some junit tests, but not

ched to.  I may need some

 to make the junit

> with "so you make your FIRST project, then pul=
l down some menus, and

a program, then if

CVS!"  This is

need to jump

nd learn
> to swim without breaking anything, maybe even fix a bug or add a=

with his or
